data.title: Beautiful wedding
data.text: The chapel is beautiful.  The stain glass makes for lovely pictures.  This is a perfect place not only for worship but weddings that are medium to large.  It is old but still in excellent shape.  The court yard is very private - great for pictures.  It is downtown so there is easy access to all the entertainment with reception areas.

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: My sister's and I have volunteered at this church for three years in a row and the work they do is impeccable. Their Ministry consist of caring for the homeless, providing meals, clothing by not only providing spiritually but physically as well.

data.title: 150 years of servie to the community
data.text: St Mary's has been serving the community for since 1870.  Perhaps not the most achitechturely ornate church but the interior is beautiful.  The Saint Mary's soup kitchen has been serving meals to those in need six times a week for almost 150 years.  Truly an asset to the community.

data.title: Beautiful Catholic Church
data.text: St. Mary's Catholic Church in downtown  Memphis is a very beautiful, spiritual place of worship.  The wood carved altar and stations of the cross were done by German immigrants and are gorgeous. I have played the organ at this church many times and feel that I am in the very presence of the Lord when I am here.

data.title: Beautiful inside
data.text: I went to May on Sunday morning. The church is the oldest Catholic church in Memphis. There are many stained glass windows and Statues here.The wood work in very nice also.

data.title: St. Mary's - Catholic Church in Memphis
data.text: When here, you know you are in a Church.  Designed by Germans and started in 1852, this will be a Church you will easily remember and will want to photograph in a most ardent way.

data.title: Beautiful Historic Catholic Church
data.text: Founded by German Franciscans.  Main and side alters carved by Franciscan Friars from wood shipped from Germany in the 19th century.  Many priests and sisters died here serving the poor during the yellow fever epidemics.  Soup kitchen has operated continuously (6 days/week) since 1870.

data.title: Historic and Memorable Catholic Church
data.text: You definitely feel you are in a holy place in this beautiful historic Catholic Church. You must visit the Grotto for prayer to the Blessed Mother, look at the beauty in the baptisimal font, the original stations of the cross, the stain glass windows, the towering pillars and the old wooden benches. What a wonderful place of peace!

data.title: Brings back memories of what a Catholic church use to be
data.text: I always attend Christmas mid-night mass here even though I belong to another church because the preservation of this church reminds me of my younger days of going to church was all about. The church is well kept and the people there are always friendly. Some newer churches these days have lost their appeal trying to be up to date and more modern but going to a church like St. Mary's helps remind me of what being catholic is all about. I hope this church never has to be torn down for any reason.

data.title: Beautiful Church
data.text: I always try to explore and visit cities old and historic churches. This is quite beautiful and a holey place.

data.title: Historic Church
data.text: Definitely a well preserved church with great history.  If Catholic, you must see - Although we have other great Catholic churches such as Immaculate Conception on Central Avenue

data.title: A special place in downtown Memphis
data.text:
Beautiful old Catholic Church with a lot of Memphis History.
We were married there.
Founded by the Franciscan priests many years ago.
The area over the building attached to the Church was used as a "Hospital" during the Yellow fever epidemic in Memphis.
There is a pencil sketch of the face of Jesus on the wall upstairs that one of the Franciscan nuns drew many years ago.
The drawing is beautiful.

data.title: German immigrant Catholic Church
data.text: Beautiful setting in a historical setting in the historical city of Memphis, TN. It is also amazing how this church was built by the Italian immigrant parishioners from St. Peter's Catholic Church for German Catholic immigrants in Memphis. Interesting how Catholic Memphis once was.

data.title: The historic interior is beautiful
data.text: Worth a stop if you are already in the area (especially if you are Catholic). The interior is lovely.

data.title: Very welcoming church
data.text: We felt so comfortable and welcome at this church! It is a beautiful church, and all of the parishioners were so welcoming to the visitors.

data.title: Memphis' Most Beautiful Catholic Church!
data.text: Beautiful German gem in Downtown Memphis with America's oldest and largest soup kitchen you can help at!  I suggest going to the Bluegrass in the Beergarden fundraiser they have once a year.  Wonderful fundraiser with great entertainment and food!

data.title: Attendance at Mass
data.text: beautiful church, like a co-cathedral.  was there for convention and priest acknowledged our presence.

data.title: Beautiful setting for a Catholic wedding
data.text: The most beautiful wedding setting in Memphis.  The wedding coordinator is great too.  We're so glad that we were able to have our daughter's wedding here with a full mass in a gorgeous setting.

data.title: Great Old Time Catholic Church
data.text: While visiting Memphis over the weekend we went to St. Mary's Catholic Church. It is a great old church with amazing details. On the left side of the church, facing the alter is a grotto honoring St Bernadette. Sadly, the parish attendance is down and the church is struggling but it is in perfect condition. The priest was very welcoming to us, knowing that we were visiting. If you do visit St. Mary's Catholic Church and attend mass, please be generous when the collection baskets come around!

data.title: Beautiful small church
data.text: We were staying at the Marriott across the street so we thought we would take a walk across the street for Sunday mass.  We arrived early and got in the front.  The priest was new to the parish so he seemed a bit nervous and off his game but he got through it.  Before we left the folks in front of us (members of the church) were very friendly and asked where we were from.  The welcomed us and were happy to hear we were just here to visit.  The church was beautiful.  I know the previous post made a comment about $5M restoration or something to that affect but this church is like 150 years old so I don't know what it looked like before but the stain glass windows and the wood pews throughout were well restored.  I would recommend to anyone that wanted to go to mass :)
